actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic and Foreign Marketing.
Committee on Agriculture. Provisions of measure incorporated into measure S. 1729 ordered to be reported.
Committee on Agriculture received executive comment from Department of Agriculture.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic and Foreign Marketing and Product Promotion

official_title: A bill to amend Section 8e of the Agricultural Adjustment Act (U.S.C. 608e-1), reenacted with Amendments by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937 so as to add kiwi fruit, peaches, pears, nectarines, and plums to the list of imported commodities that must meet the minimum quality standards of domestically produced fruits, vegetable and specialty crops.

summary.text: Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act, as reenacted by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937, to prohibit the importation of kiwifruit, peaches, pears, nectarines, and plums that do not comply with marketing order grade, size, quality, and maturity requirements.

titles.title: A bill to amend Section 8e of the Agricultural Adjustment Act (U.S.C. 608e-1), reenacted with Amendments by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937 so as to add kiwi fruit, peaches, pears, nectarines, and plums to the list of imported commodities that must meet the minimum quality standards of domestically produced fruits, vegetable and specialty crops.
